New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his first major-league postseason home run
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a 97 mph fastball into the right-field bleachers to tie the game
Ohtani shattered his bat and still muscled the ball into the outfield to load the bases
Teoscar Hernández's single brought home Ohtani and Betts to give the Dodgers a lead they wouldn’t surrender
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts said he was looking to throw the first punch
Freddie Freeman said having Shohei Ohtani on the team always helps
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said he saw his team get off the mat and fight
Max Muncy said the team had life again after Ohtani's home run
Roberts said having a superstar player like Ohtani can alleviate pressure on other players
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers overcame a three-run deficit to win 7-5
This was the Dodgers' first lead in a postseason game since Game 4 of the NLDS against the Padres last year
Shohei Ohtani has a 13-game hitting streak and is hitting well over.500 during this stretch
